intro: Ligusticum silaus, commonly known as Siberian lovage, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its rhizomes and roots are used in traditional medicine for their purported digestive and anti-inflammatory properties. Ligusticum silaus thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows.
